page.title: 10School meals
page.content: In our school, we have our own kitchen and cook, who caters for whoever wishes to have school meals. People who don't have them either go home for dinners or bring sandwiches. A dinner for one day costs 63p, so for a week it costs Â£3.15p. The school uses a cafeteria system, where children can choose what they want from a wide range of foods. One meal consists of 10 'points'. The main part of the meal consists of 4 points, the next (such as chips or a salad) is 2 points, and you can have something like peas or baked beans for one point. On the next course you can use up the rest of your points on a pudding and a drink.
